reviews.text: We are driving from North to South - I wanted to take my friends to Buellton and Solvang and to my surprise all places were booked out. In desperation I called Paul at Hotels.com and he set us up at the Santa Barbara Inn. We drove into that gorgeous town and found our place across the street from the beach!!!
reviews.title: A great place at a great price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was enormous, with a balcony. We were paying internet prices and going for the budget so we didn't get the ocean view but it didn't matter. The decor was lush, tall beds, high thread count sheets, beautiful hallways and lobby. It was a pure delight. We were stoked that Buellton and Solvang were booked out. The coffee is always hot and fresh - the personnel were helpful. My Australian friends and I will always remember this as one of our best places ever.
reviews.title: Bad value for the money! I felt like I had been robbed!

likes.disliked: — The hotel room, with it's raggedy sheets!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a rip off. One could say that it is because this hotel is located in an area, where there are very few choices. However, this didn't stop my husband and I from feeling as if we'd been robbed.
reviews.title: just say NO!

likes.liked: — free hot chocolate and friendly valet guys.
likes.disliked: — umm...too many to list (don't get me started again).

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: Pros: Location is nice. It is located across the street from a beach and within a short walk from the boardwalk. The rooms are clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cons: Beds, with old, warn out bedding. No air conditioning (we went in the middle of summer and all they had was a teeny weeny ceiling fan! Talk about STUFFY!). "Continental breakfast" that included very sparse pastries and fruit juice. No coffee maker in room. No self-parking.. Only valet or street parking available.. And I can keep going on and on. If we had paid less than $100/night, it would've been ok. But we paid over $200/night! We have stayed at better hotels that cost the same with FREE self-parking (in other beach resort areas).
reviews.title: My Worst Nightmare

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This 'Inn' is definitely a motel...nice location, but our room (overlooking the parking lot and lovely large dumpster) made my skin crawl. I used Clorox wipes on everything but we were left with a dingy room, lumpy bed, filthy carpet, and noise.
reviews.title: Worst hotel stay
Nice town - funtional hotel
reviews.text: The constant horn honking I assume came from the valet locking and unlocking vehicles in the parking lot beneath our window. And the walls are paper thin, be prepared to hear your neighbors 'getting it on'.
Fortunately I didn't see the cockroaches and giant spider that other guests mentioned in their reviews...I couldn't leave early enough the next morning as it was!
reviews.title: Bait and Switch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To the good, SB Inn offers friendly and fast valet service and free internet access.
reviews.title: Would never stay there again!

likes.disliked: — Lack of cleanliness and seedy accommodation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But never again will we stay at the Santa Barbara Inn.
reviews.title: Great value, ocean view

reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at the Santa Barbara Inn for 4 nights last month when we attended a wedding in the area. The beds were comfy, the views were beautiful. Our room was very large but during the night I got very warm ( no a/c) & had no idea we'd be listening to trains about 3 times during the night. We pretty much got used to it by the 4th night. The breakfast bar was very good & the 24 hour coffee & fruit basket was great. There is alot of traffic in front of the hotel so it does get noisey. A traffic light at the corner made it easy to cross. We did ask management to let the landscaper take a break while we were trying to relax & enjoy the pool. The restaurant on the top floor was delicious & provided a cake for a birthday we celebrated one night. It was a very nice experience. If the rooms had a/c I would definately like to visit there again.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.text: Good news: Newly refurbished rooms are nicely done. Beds have down comforters, the furniture is beach motif, and the room doesn't have any signs of mildew. Also, the location is directly across from the beach. Complimentary continental breakfast was nice (fruit, muffins, pastries, coffee, tea, cider, cocoa, OJ). Hotel's restaurant is beautiful, has an amazing view, and the food's fantastic.
reviews.title: Could've been better, just OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bad news: We witnessed a group of people who got stuck in the elevator. We used the stairs for our entire stay. The bathroom tub/shower could stand to get replaced, as it is rusting. There is a sad excuse for a pool area...not resort-like at all. It looks more like a community pool for a 50-year old apartment complex.
reviews.title: Horrible customer service, later charged my card an extra $300

reviews.text: Worse news: We had a parking lot facing view. Valet is in and outta there constantly. Very noisy if you keep your window/sliding door open. If you have an "oceanfront" room, you're still in between a major street and the beach, so I would imagine those rooms would have just as much noise level as my room did. What's worse, we stayed in a room with 2 bedrooms (Room 230), where the secondary bedroom backed up to the service elevator and stairway...no sweet dreams here, folks! Because this is an older hotel, the walls aren't insulated enough to mask the constant running of the elevator and the drunk guests stumbling up the stairs in the middle of the night. For $325/night, I expect the noise level to be minimal when I'm sleeping. Note: this is coming from someone who lives in a loud, busy, crazy town (Vegas!), and you know I tolerate a lot of noise.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel in beautiful Santa Barbara

likes.liked: — Fantastic staff, gorgeous room, great location.
likes.disliked: — Busy intersection and some traffic noise.

reviews.title: A view fit for Queens & Kings
reviews.text: It's also important to note that, if you're looking to wake up to a sunny summer day in SB, you may not get it. Both August mornings were gloomy and muggy (yes, I said August, NOT February), and it didn't clear up until 3pm! You're better off staying further south on the coast (LA, OC, or San Diego County beaches) if you want sunny sand n' surf. I'm usually not this critical of beach locations, but since I grew up near the beach, I know the difference in weather patterns.
Pro:
reviews.title: Good value for families
Great location, good value.
reviews.text: two separate bedrooms, 1 with king, other with 2 queens
very spacious
reviews.title: extremely disappointing

likes.disliked: — very poor value, very basic accommodation and facilities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: pool
reviews.title: Delightful stay!

likes.liked: — location across from the beach, great ambiance and comfort
likes.disliked: — Santa Barbara does have many vagrants because of the moderate weather, and they inhabit nearby parks.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2 minute walk to east beach
reviews.title: Very nice!
